questions.question: Pathogens cause____________ diseases?
Only animals can be infected by pathogens?

imageMetadata.resources: Answer: False animals and plants can be infected by pathogens.

questions.resources: Answer: False animals and plants can be infected by pathogens.

questions.question: This is not a type of pathogen?

imageMetadata.resources: Answer cancer is a non-communicable disease, it is disease which is produced by non-medical agents

questions.resources: Answer cancer is a non-communicable disease, it is disease which is produced by non-medical agents

questions.question: How are pathogens spread?
Bacteria make you feel ill by producing toxins which __________________?
Viruses also make you feel ill by cell damage. But are viruses cells?

imageMetadata.resources: Answer: A virus is not a cell and it is 1/100 of the size of a bacterium.

questions.resources: Answer: A virus is not a cell and it is 1/100 of the size of a bacterium.

questions.question: What is the simplest way to reduce the spread of disease?

imageMetadata.resources: Answer: Being hygienic washing your hands after the toilet and when you have sneezed. Only works for certain diseases but it is the simplest and most effective method.

questions.resources: Answer: Being hygienic washing your hands after the toilet and when you have sneezed. Only works for certain diseases but it is the simplest and most effective method.

questions.question: Why is it now harder to treat Gonorrhoea?

choices.answer: Antibiotics have become resistant to strains of the bacteria
The price of condoms has increased
Reduction in the quantity of STD clinics provided by the NHS

questions.question: What symptoms of rose black spot infection are shown on the leaves of rose plants?

choices.answer: Purple and black spots, yellow leaves
Stunted growth and purple and black spots on the stem
Abnormal growth, purple and black spots on the stem
Purple and black spots on the roots

questions.question: Mosquitoes are the __________ in the development of malaria.

imageMetadata.resources: Answer: the mosquitoes are vector which does not get the disease.  The protist is the single-celled eukaryote.

questions.resources: Answer: the mosquitoes are vector which does not get the disease.  The protist is the single-celled eukaryote.

questions.question: How are the trachea and the bronchi adapted to defend against the entry of pathogens?

choices.answer: Lined with cilia that waft the mucus
Allow the mucus to be swallowed and destroyed in the stomach

questions.question: The most important component of the immune system is _____________.
What is phagocytosis?

choices.answer: When a white blood cell produces antibodies
White blood cell engulfs a foreign cell and digests them
When a white blood cell produces antitoxins

questions.question: What do vaccinations stimulate white blood cells to produce?

imageMetadata.resources: Answer: Your body produces antibodies and the pathogen carries antigens

questions.resources: Answer: Your body produces antibodies and the pathogen carries antigens

questions.question: What is the main limitation of using antibiotics to treat disease?
What is meant by the efficacy of a drug?

choices.answer: Whether the drug works and it produces the desired effects
How cost effective the drug is
